title: DERIVED FROM: MAVEN SWEA (Solar Wind Electron Analyzer) Archive 3D Distributions  - David L. Mitchell (mitchell@ssl.berkeley.edu) (UC Berkeley Space Sciences Laboratory)

info.x_cadence_note: Counts based on variable 'epoch' in https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/sp_phys/data/maven/swea/l2/arc3d/2014/03/mvn_swe_l2_arc3d_20140320_v04_r01.cdf. The most common cadence occurred for 57.5467% of the 1079 timesteps. Cadence = 8000020032 [ns] = PT8.00002S.
info.contact: David L. Mitchell (mitchell@ssl.berkeley.edu) @ UC Berkeley Space Sciences Laboratory

parameters.name: Time
parameters.x_description: Time, center of sample, in TT2000 time base

parameters.name: binning
parameters.description: Energy binning factor: 1 = 64 energies, 2 = 32 energies, 4 = 16 energies

parameters.name: counts
parameters.description: [no-plot for now]Raw instrument counts

parameters.name: diff_en_fluxes
parameters.description: Calibrated Differential Energy Flux [vary with time, energy, deflection index and azimuth angle] at 1st Deflection Index[Thumbnails, select a few hours]

parameters.name: variance
parameters.description: Variance of differential energy flux (unavailable before 2014/11/15)

parameters.name: secondary
parameters.description: Secondary electron contamination (unavailable before 2014/11/15)

parameters.name: diff_en_fluxes_mv
parameters.description: ---> Movie of above [flux vs. energy and azimuth angle]. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['diff_en_fluxes']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: diff_en_fluxes_spec1
parameters.description: ---> Spectrogram at selected Azimuth Angle bins 1,4,7,10,13,16. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['diff_en_fluxes']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
